page.title: 15Employment within the block
page.content: There is no large employer in the block but several employers provide work for smaller numbers. Local farms employ some workers but since the spread of mechanisation in recent years, both in stock- and land-management, farming is not so labour-intensive as previously. Some workers are employed at the gravel pit and the refuse tip at Stretton Sugwas; some are engaged in fruit farming; some work at Wyevale Garden Centre and its nurseries, which also accept horticultural students for practical training. There are jobs too with a small building firm started in 1938 by the present owner's father and uncle, which does general building work. Local service industries also provide some jobs, i.e. public houses, filling station, shop.
